channel.title: Help! Really Simple
channel.description:
Hello,
Im just beginning to learn how to code, I've spent some time trying this and I am improving :). But, so I've hear of Public (class, void, etc), but I know there are Private. What do the private do?

item.title: Help! Really Simple
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

If you’re talking about private fields, it prevents them from being accessed from outside of that class. If you try it’ll give you compile errors. This achieves encapsulation, letting you maintain consistency (for example) by making all operations go through public methods that you’ve defined.

Read full topic
